q: "( Fiat Chairman) John Elkann and Sergio Marchionne have confirmed to the government the intention of pursuing the Italian group's development objectives," Silvio Berlusconi 's office said in a statement on Saturday after the meeting. The government acknowledges positively the intentions shown by the company as well as its role on the global market. Fiat's plan for Italy, known as Fabbrica Italia, envisages 20 billion euros($ 27 billion) of investment in exchange for more flexibility at its five auto plants in Italy. We welcome
